channel.title: Oh no!
channel.description:
Looters are breaking into your home, how do you defend your technology?
This is only towards the people who live in England

item.title: Oh no!
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Bowser jr, post:39, topic:409094”][quote author=Cole1497 link=topic=510377.msg3705865#msg3705865 date=1313027029]

If guns were legal it’d be more likely the “angsty teen” would break in with a gun rather than a knife.

Criminals tend to not care if their weapon is legal or not. Just my thoughts.
[/quote]
It is all about compensating for the added risk. If I were to break into Mopars house for some evil reason I would had to shoot him on sight since I knew he had a gun, if I knew he didn’t have any gun he could be a lot safer.[/quote]

No thanks. Then I have no defense at all if a mob of people break into my house.

@Brolapse, sure, you can arm yourself with a knife too and maybe put up a fight against one, maybe even two bad guys with a knife, any more and you would be dead. Also an old lady or handicap person would be dead against even one attacker, not so with guns.

@All rioters having guns, ridiculous. You guys linked to all the riots in the US, did all those rioters have guns? No. Regardless, a criminal doesn’t care if having a gun is against the law or not, by definition they break laws.

Read full topic

item.title: Oh no!

item.description:

[quote=“Cole1497, post:38, topic:409094”][quote author=Brolapse link=topic=510377.msg3705088#msg3705088 date=1312983402]
If guns were legal it’d be more likely the “angsty teen” would break in with a gun rather than a knife.
[/quote]
Criminals tend to not care if their weapon is legal or not. Just my thoughts.[/quote]
It is all about compensating for the added risk. If I were to break into Mopars house for some evil reason I would had to shoot him on sight since I knew he had a gun, if I knew he didn’t have any gun he could be a lot safer.

Read full topic

item.title: Oh no!
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“eczema3, post:35, topic:409094”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=510377.msg3704736#msg3704736 date=1312952255]

The local shopping area down the road from me has been smashed up in the past few hours, it’s 3:47am at the moment. Pretty much everything has had its windows put in.

There are hoards of angry men down the road from me, and my only defensive weapon is fly spray.

And suddenly allowing law-abiding citizens to own guns for self defense suddenly looks much better!

Here, I’d just shoot them if they broke into my house. Then the police would come and remove the bodies.
[/quote]
The police wouldn’t come move the bodies because they’re too busy trying to fix the riots, which would be far far far far far worse if everyone had guns…[/quote]
Not to mention the resources spent trying to prove if murder was self defense

Read full topic

ITT - but only the houseowners would be allowed to own guns. Police would confiscate them from the rioters of course

item.title: Oh no!
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

cumescape:

England how does it feel that if some angsty teen breaks into your house with a knife you can’t defend yourself?

I’d arm myself with a kitchen knife… they aren’t illegal. If guns were legal it’d be more likely the “angsty teen” would break in with a gun rather than a knife.

Anyways I don’t want to start a discussion about gun laws, America likes how it is there, we like how it is here. If you don’t then feel free to move to whichever place you prefer.

Read full topic

item.title: Oh no!
item.dc:creator: @cumescape cumescape
item.description:
@cumescape wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:29, topic:409094”]And suddenly allowing law-abiding citizens to own guns for self defense suddenly looks much better!

Here, I’d just shoot them if they broke into my house. Then the police would come and remove the bodies.[/quote]Someone who finally understands the point of the thread. England how does it feel that if some angsty teen breaks into your house with a knife you can’t defend yourself? Meanwhile if someone did that here I could legally shoot them, first I would start with the knee caps.

item.title: Oh no!
item.dc:creator: @Budda Budda
item.description:
@Budda wrote:

[QUOTE=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Presidency_of_Barack_Obama#Legislation_signed]Legislation signed
[edit] 2009

January 29: Lilly Ledbetter Fair Pay Act
February 4: Children’s Health Insurance Reauthorization Act
February 11: DTV Delay Act
February 17: American Recovery and Reinvestment Act
March 30: Omnibus Public Lands Management Act of 2009
April 21: Edward M. Kennedy Serve America Act
May 20: Fraud Enforcement and Recovery Act
May 20: Helping Families Save Their Homes Act of 2009
May 22: Credit Card Accountability, Responsibility, and Disclosure Act of 2009
June 22: Family Smoking Prevention and Tobacco Control Act
August 6: Cash For Clunkers Extension Act
October 22: Veterans Health Care Budget Reform and Transparency Act
October 28: Matthew Shepard and James Byrd Jr. Hate Crimes Prevention Act
October 28: National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2010
October 30: Ryan White HIV/AIDS Treatment Extension Act
November 6: Worker, Homeownership, and Business Assistance Act of 2009

[edit] 2010

January 27: Emergency Aid to American Survivors of Haiti Earthquake Act
March 4: Travel Promotion Act
March 18: Hiring Incentives to Restore Employment Act (HIRE Act)
March 23: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act
March 30: Health Care and Education Reconciliation Act of 2010
May 5: Caregivers and Veterans Omnibus Health Services Act of 2010
May 17: Daniel Pearl Freedom of the Press Act
July 1: Comprehensive Iran Sanctions, Accountability, and Divestment Act
July 21: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act
July 22: Unemployment Compensation Extension Act of 2010
July 22: Improper Payments Elimination and Recovery Act of 2010
August 10: SPEECH Act of 2010
September 27: Small Business Jobs and Credit Act of 2010
December 9: Animal Crush Video Prohibition Act of 2010
December 13: Healthy, Hunger-Free Kids Act of 2010
December 17: Tax Relief, Unemployment Insurance Reauthorization, and Job Creation Act of 2010
December 22: Don't Ask, Don't Tell Repeal Act of 2010

[edit] 2011

January 2: James Zadroga 9/11 Health and Compensation Act of 2010 (H.R. 847 )
January 4: Food Safety and Modernization Act, Pub.L. 111-353, H.R. 2751
January 7: National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2011
August 2: Budget Control Act of 2011

[/QUOTE]

Yeah…only healthcare.

Read full topic

item.title: Oh no!
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

Like I said, it’s basically all started since Obama became president tehee

en.wikipedia.org

List of riots

This is a chronological list of known riots.


en.wikipedia.org

List of riots | 2011

1.2011 – Riots in Assam, Meghalaya, Northeast India, 4 dead. | 2.2011 – Riots in Arusha, Tanzania, 2 dead and nine people injured. | 3.2011 – Riots in Algeria, 2 dead and four hundred people injured in riots linked to food price increases and unemployment. | 4.2011 – Riots in Tunisia, at least 219 killed. | 5.2011 – Riots in Jos, Nigeria, more than 30 people dead. | 6.2011 – Riots in Tirana, Albania, 3 killed, 17 policemen and soldiers were injured, includi

Why so many nowadays…

[quote=“Niall, post:17, topic:409094”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=510377.msg3703795#msg3703795 date=1312913453]
Lucky Luyk riot, October 1982 (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
Coronation riot, April 30, 1980, (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
Nieuwmarkt riot, March - April 1975 (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
[/quote]

there were riots in london in the '80s and '90s too, what’s your point?[/quote]No point, someone had just said ‘no riots in the Netherlands’ so I looked it up

Read full topic

item.title: Oh no!
item.dc:creator: @Budda Budda
item.description:
@Budda wrote:

Frell:

i beleve al des riots r good prof US shud folo urop

2010 - University of Tennessee Lane Kiffin Riot. Students riot on the Knoxville campus following head football coach Lane Kiffin’s announcement that he took the head coaching job at the University of Southern California.
2010 - University of Maryland basketball disturbance 2010, College Park, Maryland, March 3 following a game; 28 arrested.
2010 - Springfest Riot, April 10, 200 police disperse crowd of 8000 using tear gas, pepper spray, rubber bullets and bean bag rounds, near the campus of James Madison University; dozens injured; 30-35 arrested., Harrisonburg, Virginia
2010 – Santa Cruz May Day riot, May 1, 250 rampage through downtown Santa Cruz attacking 18 businesses, causing an estimated $100,000 in damages. 1 arrested. Santa Cruz, California
2010 – L.A. Lakers riot, June 17, Fans riot in Downtown Los Angeles after Lakers win championship, 50 arrested. Los Angeles, California
2010 – BART Verdict riot, July 8, Riot breaks out in response to verdict in the killing of Oscar Grant, BART Police shooting of Oscar Grant. About 100 businesses were damaged and 78 people were arrested, Oakland, California
2010 - Eugene Melee, Sept 25, Riot breaks out west of the University of Oregon campus as police use tear gas to break up a rowdy party. 9 arrested. Eugene, Oregon
2010 - Oakland Protest riot, Nov. 5, Police made more than 150 arrests as a crowd broke windows and knocked down fences, protesting sentence of former BART officer in shooting of Oscar Grant on New Years Day 2009 see BART Police shooting of Oscar Grant., Oakland,

Read full topic
